DataElement.preferredName: Osteoporosis Study of Osteoporotic Fractures Frailty Index Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by reduced bone mass, with a decrease in cortical thickness and in the number and size of the trabeculae of cancellous bone (but normal chemical composition), resulting in increased fracture incidence._A frailty index consisting of 3 components: weight loss, the subjectÂ’s inability to rise from a chair 5 times without using their arms, and reduced energy level._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
